comments.html: Obviously it works... as far as someone is willing to accept /32 from the data center. The fundamental question remains, though: WHY do we need to move VMs between data centers, and WHY does someone claim that broken applications deserve this level of complexity and perpetual technical debt.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: I agree - and in particular WHY web front-end VMs, which are supposedly stateless. Still, I believe it is worthwhile to have a solution in place which can support vMotion between DCs when needed, with optimized routing even for individual VMs. But just because you can, doesn't mean you should
comments.name: Jeroen van Bemmel
